factText: Search and rescue efforts underway in Monroe, Louisiana, following destructive tornado #Topbuzz https://t.co/ZzpKDp8zSs. Search and rescue efforts underway in Monroe, Louisiana, following destructive tornado #SmartNews  https://t.co/EUWGos7REE

Just reading reports of EF5 tornadoes hitting southern #Mississippi right now, winds 170-205 MPH. The Monroe tornado has now been rated an EF-3 (originally it was rated an EF-2), with max wind at 140 mph!. A couple of tornadoes possible and wind gusts up to 70 MPH likely. Radar indicates 70 mph winds with this storm, which could cause considerable tree damage. Over parts of Louisiana, multiple tornadoes appeared, and the weather service reported damaging winds.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_Tornado_What was the estimated wind speed of the tornado?

factText:
Two F5 tornadoes touched down today in Mississippi, damn. The National Weather Service in Tallahassee confirms that a brief tornado touched down in Irwin County Monday morning. Earlier on Sunday, a tornado touched down in central Texas, about 50 miles east of Austin, knocking down trees and power lines in its path.

. A deadly group of tornadoes touched down in Mississippi. 

. For those of you who don't know, Mississippi had multiple tornadoes and thunderstorms touch down last night.

Alabama, Louisiana and Mississippi all declared a state of emergency Sunday. Alabama, Georgia, Louisiana and Mississippi have all declared a state of emergency in response to the storms, which included several powerful tornadoes, flash flooding and large hail. Catastrophic tornadoes led to a State of Emergency being declared in Mississippi. Gov. John Bel Edwards declares STATE of EMERGENCY in LOUISIANA after Easter tornadoes.

Blount and Monroe Counties under a tornado watch until 2am

Watch out Maryville. A Tornado Watch has just been issued for Monroe, McMinn and Blount counties. Polk Township as well as all of Monroe County and neighboring communities have been place under a Tornado Watch from now until 6 pm Monday April 13th 2020. Tift County is still under a tornado watch at this time.

Rivers, creeks and streams are rising and flooding is being reported. Heavy rain is still moving through our region with areas of street flooding possible. • Moderate to major river flooding continues along the Mississippi River. Trees were brought down and streets flooded in Alabama, Tennessee and Georgia, and much of the region remains under flash flood, thunderstorm and tornado warnings.

. Flash flooding is in imminent or occurring in the warned area.

Tornado warnings (11pm) in Georgia, Alabama, and South Carolina. #Tornado warnings popping up left and right for southeastern #US. A #Tornado Warning Issued For Upson and Talbot Until 2:30 AM https://t.co/MxpGr5JeQ1 https://t.co/Vjzwesegn4. The first tornado warning for South Carolina has been issued near Greenville. A new #TORNADO WARNING has been issued in Southwest Georgia. New #Tornado warning issued including #Seneca, #Clemson, #Pendleton #SouthCarolina.

#Tornado watch has been issued for the Charlotte area through 8am - be sure you have a way to get severe weather warnings and be ready to take action!. Multiple #tornado warnings and #severe #storm warnings. Tornado Warning issued for many counties until 8:00 a.m.
. NWS has issued a Tornado Watch for our area until 7pm tonight. TORNADO WARNING | A Tornado Warning has been issued for Tuscaloosa and Jefferson counties in Alabama.

Tornadoes and severe weather left more than�17,500 people in Mississippi without power. There are parts of Tennessee, Mississippi and Arkansas dealing with power outages as a result of the storms moving through. Tornadoes and storms have hit the South hard, with 1.3 million without electricity.

. At least 16 people were killed after tornadoes began ripping through the South on Easter, destroying homes and storefronts and leaving over 1 million people without power.

DADE AND WALKER COUNTY ARE UNDER A TORNADO WARNING!. #Atlanta and good part of #Georgia now under a #tornadowatch. We are watching out for the potential for severe weather across the Charlotte area and are under a TORNADO WATCH. Devastation in some parts of #Mississippi after huge #tornadoes hit the area last night!. At least 40 tornadoes went through the South and displaced its residents. #Tornado EMERGENCY for Ooltewah and Collegedale.

https://t.co/EivKyIHuXw. Tornadoes cause major damage in the Monroe, LA area this weekend.

At least 34 tornadoes were reported in Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi and Georgia as of this morning. 40 tornadoes have been reported from Texas to Tennessee. A tornado has been sighted or indicated by weather radar.
At least 7 people passed away in southeast Mississippi due to the violent tornadoes that happened there. Up to 19 people reported dead from severe storms over the last 24 hours.

Mississippi has been hit by multiple destructive and deadly tornadoes causing people to flock to shelters despite social distancing rules. In Mississippi tornados killed 11 and made many people homeless.

This fast moving graphic will show you the devastating path of the Easter 2020 tornado outbreak. "There were more than 40 reports of tornadoes as the storms that began on Easter Sunday tore a deadly and destructive path from Texas and Arkansas, across Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and Georgia and into the Carolinas and Tennessee. Right now, parts of the South are picking up after destructive tornadoes ripped through on Easter Sunday.

factText: From Sunday's tornado, Jeff Davis County is reporting four fatalities, 100 homes damaged, 40 roads closed because of debris, 40 roads closed because of damage, 75-80 displaced residents and multiple powerlines down, according to MEMA. I-59 is closed for 60 Miles in both directions Mississippi due to tornado debris on the road.

Tornado watch has been CANCELED for Tallahassee and areas where storms have passed through. The National Weather Service in Mobile has CANCELLED the Tornado Watch for Monroe County. 1:50am- The Tornado WATCH for McMinn, Monroe & Blount Cos. has been CANCELED. This event has been CANCELED!. The tornado warning for Prince William county has been canceled.

#Tornado damage on HWY 210 E with powerlines and trees down blocking the road. News outlets reported downed trees, flooded streets and other damage in Alabama, Tennessee and Georgia. Hamilton County, TN officials say 150 structures reported damaged.

"FEMA" will activate & come to help these American citizens find temp housing ,food & rebuild. Many people are taking cover in their basements and officials are working to open shelters for those who have had to leave their home.

factText: Presbyterian Disaster Assistance (PDA) has reached out to Mississippi Presbytery and Presbytery of the Pines to offer assistance after receiving news of tornadoes over the weekend. The United Way of Northeast Louisiana has set up a tornado relief fund to support those in need in their community. This UWNELA Tornado Relief Fund will be used to support immediate relief efforts and Long-Term Recovery that will enable people to return to their homes.

Governor @Tate Reeves is updating Mississippi on the Tornado outbreak that impacted thousands of Mississippians yesterday and the continuing fight against the #COVID19 outbreak. Our Alabama, Arkansas, Georgia and Mississippi teams have been providing extensive coverage of the storm track and damage done by the heavy rain, wind and tornadoes over Easter Sunday. Excellent coverage of the #Tornado Outbreak in Southeast - LIVE SEVERE WEATHER COVERAGE https://t.co/lbMzr7GM7h via @YouTube

factText: More than a dozen tornadoes spawned from a strong storm that pummeled across Mississippi and Louisiana, leaving residents already on coronavirus lockdown even more vulnerable.

TORNADO OUTBREAK: At least 26 people are dead across four states, including 11 in Mississippi, where drone footage shows the path of one of nearly 60 reported tornadoes from Texas to North Carolina in 24 hours, with tornado watches extending into the Mid-Atlantic and Northeast Monday afternoon.

Red Crossers, while adhering to local social distancing policies, are hard at work assessing damage in communities affected by Easter Sunday's tornadoes and storms.". After dozens of tornadoes ravaged the Southeast on Easter Sunday and into Monday, killing at least 19 people and damaging hundreds of homes, we are assessing the damage and are ready to deploy to multiple locations. The Salvation Army Alabama, Louisiana, Mississippi Division is responding to the #EasterTornado outbreak.

Deadly tornadoes during a severe weather outbreak across parts of Southeast US brought at least 31 fatalities last night!. #BREAKING: Death toll rises to 6 following violent tornadoes in southern Mississippi. Tornadoes killed at least 31 people and destroyed hundreds of structures in several Southern states.
. Death toll from tornadoes and severe storms in the South rises to 18. A well-forecast tornado/severe storm outbreak has killed 18 people between yesterday and this morning.
